column4: junglecrazd1; fstab doesn't do well with spaces mount points. try to take out the spaces and be sure you have created the directory
junglecrazd1; for one in /media you'll need to use sudo .. sudo mkdir /media/directoryname .. if possible make the mount point a single word instead of two.
plouffe; compiz is the fork of beryl. if you're on hardy you already have compiz installed
how do I set it up right?
